candidates.title: Add authors to all crates
Create default enabled features for large web events

labels.name: web
labels.description: relating to the web renderer for dioxus

candidates.body: Some of the web events are quite large and rairly used. For example, the onmounted event will not be used in most applications. This PR pulls those events out into features that are enabled by default so that users can use the crate with no default features for smaller binary sizes

candidates.title: Don't spawn a new tokio runtime every fullstack request
candidates.body:
This reuses a pool of futures instead of spawning a new tokio runtime on every request which should make server function performance better.

For a server function returning static text, this seems to be about twice as fast

candidates.title: Switch to launch builder instead of macro for fullstack
Create cli bundle command
candidates.body:
Creates a bundle command for the CLI desktop targets.

Currently this has only been confirmed to work for Windows (x64) and MacOs (arm). Linux targets have not been tested.

candidates.title: Add computed hook
candidates.body: Adds a new computed hook that allows you to efficiently diff data before marking any scopes that read from the data as dirty. This is similar to a selector

candidates.title: Update license field following SPDX 2.1 license expression standard
candidates.body: The new recommendation is to follow the SPDX 2.1 standard. This allows automatic license verification software to work properly. Reference: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-license-and-license-file-fields

candidates.title: Fix: dont use bumpslab anymore, just box scopestates
candidates.body:
While working on #1225 I noticed that miri isn't passing in one of our tests. I think it's a new regression.

This change expands our CI to run miri on every core test and removes the bumpslab in favor of simply boxing each scope state.

We take a slight performance hit but I don't think it matters too much. And now, we know that scopestates properly drop their contents.

candidates.title: Improve auto formatting multiline raw attributes/event handlers
candidates.body: Fixes a few issues I ran into while trying to get autofmt to work for the docsite. Mainly handlers with multiple lines and multi-line raw attributes were not formatted correctly

candidates.title: Halve Build Times
candidates.body:
This roughly halfs build times for a hello world example.

Relies on https://github.com/DioxusLabs/prettier-please/pull/1 being published as the `0.2` version

candidates.title: feat(check): adds `dx check`
candidates.body: At the moment this only checks the [Rules of Hooks](https://dioxuslabs.com/docs/0.3/guide/en/interactivity/hooks.html ), ensuring that hook functions (i.e. `use_*`) are being called as expected. TODO: - [x] more tests - [ ] add Rules of Hooks link to issue report output? Closes #1202

candidates.title: Move desktop hot reload into the CLI
candidates.body:
This PR moves hot reloading from the hot_reload_init macro to the CLI.

This has a few advantages:
- Hot reloading can detect changes when rebuilding the application
- All platforms use the CLI to serve applications

candidates.title: chore: rename `playwrite` to `playwright`
candidates.body: I assume this was a mistake and not intentional.

candidates.title: Use server function hook
Rip out async components in favor of a simpler suspense
candidates.body:
This PR rips out async components, once again enabling us to use anything that implements `IntoIterator<T: IntoTemplate>`. It makes our suspense system simpler, with the limitation that it's really only useful for SSR.

Loading states are not implemented, so components will be blank until their data is ready.

This is being done in a forward-compatible way, so we can add loading states and tree-based suspense later into the 0.4 release.

candidates.title: Remove the `dioxus` bin for the `dx` bin
candidates.body: This PR renames `dioxus` to `dx` in the CLI. It's shorter, cuter, and a little bit more project-agnostic so we can work with other wasm projects and tools.

candidates.title: better diagnostics for use_shared_state
candidates.body:
Currently it is quite hard to debug what causes the panics at runtime, this is an attempt making it a bit less intimidating for new users.
I also propose exposing the `try_*` methods in case someone wanted to handle the errors somehow (current implementation crashes and leaves the application frozen which might be really confusing to end user)

changelist: 
 - expose `try_*` methods on `UseSharedState<T>`
 - add meaningful panic information on `read()`/`write()` errors
 - unify `thiserror`'s versions across all packages and make it a `workspace`-wide dependency
 - above mentioned `read()` / `write()` methods also track callers in debug mode, providing specific location at which borrow error occurred in the panic message

candidates.title: CLI HTTPS
candidates.body:
Adds support for localhost HTTPs using either custom or [mkcert](https://github.com/FiloSottile/mkcert) auto-generated certificates.

This PR adds a few new ``Dioxus.toml`` options:
```toml
[web.https]
enabled = true
mkcert = false
cert_path = "./cert.pem"
key_path = "./key.pem"
```

mkcert generated certificates are stored in an ``ssl`` folder:
![image](https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/assets/30190859/4fef01d3-fac1-4a5b-a00b-4816966922c0)


Closes #1168

candidates.title: Extract the vscode extension into its own module with wasm
candidates.body:
Instead of relying on the CLI to be installed, move all the methods for doing extension stuff into its own extension crate.

This should allow the extension to be decoupled from the CLI, making it more reliable.

It also turns on the extension automatically whenever a Rust file is opened, which should make things like autoformatting automatic.

This also releases the extension.

candidates.title: fix: Remove duplicated doc links and improved some descriptions
candidates.body:
## Changes
- Updated some descriptions to make them more clear
- Removed `documentation` links so they get filled with the generated link from `docs.rs`
- Updated some `homepage` links with platform-specific guides (e.g desktop, tui, ssr, etc)

Feel free to edit anything you think didn't have to be modified 👍

candidates.title: Feat: add `dx` as a package and move plugin to feature
candidates.body:
We want to alias dioxus to dx now, so the easiest way is to install both so people aren't confused.

`dx` = `dioxus` on the CLI.

Kinda like vc = vercel.

Also, this pulls out the plugin system into a feature to help reduce build times. They're still quite long :/

candidates.title: Add iOS + Android example to mainline
candidates.body:
Similar to the PWA example, we now integrate iOS into the mainline.

This also features a fix to Dioxus Desktop that broke touch interactions.

candidates.title: Window Close Behaviour
candidates.body:
This implements the functionality outlined in the following issue:

https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/issues/1122

For macOS, it adds the `objc` dependency as that is required to call the correct selector, `[NSApplication hide:]`. This will hide the window in a way that it appears again when the user switches back to the app.

On Linux or Windows clicking the icon in the tab bar should make it visible again.

candidates.title: Fix playwrite tests
candidates.body: Makes the playwrite tests compile with the latest version of fullstack

candidates.title: Change missing trailing comma span to be more helpful
candidates.body:
First time contributing, let me know if something should be different e.g. where I place the test and so on (or if you disagree with the PR altogether).

I noticed if I forget a trailing comma, the span info pointed to the span _before_ the one I expected.

```rust
// user code
rsx!{
  p { class: "foo bar" 
    "hi"
  }
}

// stderr before
error: missing trailing comma
 --> tests/rsx/trailing-comma-0.rs:9:20
  |
9 |             class: "foo bar"
  |             ^^^^^

// stderr after
error: missing trailing comma
 --> tests/rsx/trailing-comma-0.rs:9:20
  |
9 |             class: "foo bar"
  |                    ^^^^^^^^^
```

So I changed the span to the one after, and added a test to verify the new stderr.

candidates.title: Stub out File input and RFD on iOS
Add on unmount hook
candidates.body: The question of how to clean up side effects has come up several times in the discord. This adds a simple on unmount hook to the Dioxus hooks crate. The hook just uses a drop implementation internally to run when the component is cleaned up

candidates.title: fix(docs): Fix dioxus-hooks crate description
candidates.body: Feel free to edit it if you think of a better description :D

candidates.title: Add CLI back into Dioxus Mainline
candidates.body: This PR moves the CLI back into the Dioxus monorepo so we can properly version the interfaces shared among the ecosystem. I will need to work with @mrxiaozhuox to ensure proper admin rights, etc.

candidates.title: Fix: bump liveview salvo version to 0.44.1. (#1124)
candidates.body: bump liveview salvo version to 0.44.1

candidates.title: Fix `cargo doc` by using a fixed variant of interprocess
candidates.body: I had to publish a new version of interprocess that fixes the docs issue, but now we can get interprocess properly creating docs, and thusly, our published versions can create docs.

candidates.title: Make registering server functions optional
candidates.body: The latest version of the server functions crate was updated to use inventory to make registering server functions optional. This PR updates Dioxus server functions to the latest commit

candidates.title: Workspace Dependancies

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body: Updates the dependencies that are used commonly across Dioxus crates to use [workspace dependencies](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/workspaces.html#the-dependencies-table). This should be helpful keeping the versions of crates across the workspace synced and make it easier to move packages.

candidates.title: Convert use_eval to use send/recv system

labels.name: web
labels.description: relating to the web renderer for dioxus

labels.name: desktop
labels.description: Suggestions related to the desktop renderer

candidates.title: create end to end tests using playwright
candidates.body:
Adds new end to end tests running in a browser for:
- Web: Rendering + Interaction
- Liveview: Rending + Interaction
- Fullstack: Rending + Interaction + Server Communication
